intro: Machilus liangkwangensis, commonly known as the Liangkwang mahogany, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to China, specifically found in the Guangxi and Guangdong provinces. The plant is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, typically reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a dark green upper surface with a lighter underside. The tree produces small, fragrant flowers followed by edible, elliptical berries that are an important food source for local wildlife.
